body.name: Curad Bulk Variety Pack Assorted Bandages, Flex-Fabric, Waterproof, Plastic, Knuckle, Heavy Duty Bandages (320Count)
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Wednesday, February 21 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 15 hrs 20 mins
features: Economical variety pack has an assortment of 320 bandage sizes and types for at-home first aid treatment of minor cuts, scrapes and burns
All bandages have 4-sided seal technology to help keep dirt and germs out
Medium waterproof 1x2.5 inch bandages with breathable, ultra-thin polyurethane backing
Plastic .75x3 inch bandages designed to stay put all day
Assorted flex-fabric bandages that stretch, bend and breathe
Assorted sheer bandages that are less noticeable on skin
body.description: Inside you will find these various Curad styles. For every home bandage need. All our bandages have 4-sided seal technology, to keep dirt and germs out! Medium waterproof, Ultra thin, breathable material; Ultra thin polyurethane backing with a long lasting adhesive that stays on strong even through moisture exposure. Assorted Flex-Fabric, fabric stretches with movement; designed for people with active lifestyles, who require a bandage to "stay put" Even when wet. Assorted sheer, less noticeable on your skin; sheer bandages are designed to blend with your skin for a more discreet look. Assorted heavy duty/plastic, All Purpose long-lasting protection; designed to last longer and 'stay put' Under the most active of lifestyle; tough fabric and extreme hold adhesive for extended wear; heavy duty bandages are made with a heavy-duty fabric for maximum protection of hardworking hands. Flex-fabric finger/Knuckle, fabric stretches with movement; designed for fingers to bend and move for active lifestyles.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Curad Bulk Variety Pack Assorted Bandages PLASTIC: provide all-purpose protection for minor cuts, scrapes and abrasions.ASSORTED FLEX-FABRIC: stretchy and breathable for maximum comfort and mobilityASSORTED SHEER: discrete coverage that won’t clash with your natural skin toneWATERPROOF: helps keep wounds dry throughout your water activitiesASSORTED HEAVY DUTY: maximum durability and holdFINGERTIP/KNUCKLE: covers difficult-to-protect areas on handsNON-STICK PADS: won’t stick to or disrupt the wound from healing4-SIDED SEAL: Bandages are designed with 4-sided seal around the wound to keep out dirt and germs

Flex-Fabric, Waterproof, Plastic, Knuckle, Heavy Duty Bandages The CURAD 320-count Variety Pack contains a wide variety of bandage types is perfect for businesses, schools or just to stock up at home. To tackle every type of first aid need, we put together bandage styles that come in various sizes and shapes. The styles include plastic, Flex-Fabric, sheer, waterproof, heavy-duty, and fingertip and knuckle bandages. All included bandages have a four-sided seal to fend off dirt and germs.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: These bandaids are an amazing set for what you pay. The variety accounts for any wound you would typically have. They're not "cute," but they're functional. My kids would rather have pretty patterns, but at the rate that they ask for band aids, I can't afford a huge box of colored bandaids. These are perfect. One small wish would be that they came in smaller sizes to fit toddler wounds.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wow! HUUUUUGE assortment!
reviews.reviewText: I bought these to refresh our earthquake preparedness kit. I was able to refill the kit, all of our family cars, the camper, and even my classroom! There is every size and material in this box. I’m impressed!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Husband's black Friday purchase
reviews.reviewText: Hahaha so the ONLY thing my husband ordered on black Friday was two boxes of these. Apparently we need 100s of bandaids🤣🤣......As far as bandaid go, these are great. Lots of different sizes haha

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This is a very large selection.
reviews.reviewText: This should last a family of 5 for over a year. Very well stocked with an assortment of sizes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars its has alot of assorted bandages for its cost its quite cheap,
reviews.reviewText: for 320 pieces its quite cheap. but i was mildy disappointed most of them were not fabric. most of them were plastic bandaids, which are known to cause allergic reaction, it seems to enhance the allergic reaction on top of the adhesive. especially if you have a allergy to bandaid adhesives/plastic. Also this seems to be pretty common allergy problem amongst other brands, and generic ones, some cause a nastier reaction than others. i used it mainly for atopic dermatitis rash, after i put on topical medication and covering it, it keeps the medication and rash from getting irritated partially.Also the adhesives quite a hit and miss. the fabric ones dont seem to have much adhesive and they tend to fall off quite easily, only some of plastic ones fall of quite eaisly. but i was pleasantly surprised how well they stayed on unlike the fabric ones. could it be the plastic and adhesives are better at sticking?Also the bandaids seems to be less effective if your skin sheds alot due to dermatitis, or its wet, or its an ointment.it doesnt stick as well. so be sure to use on dry surfaces, and skin should be as smooth as possible. damaged skin sticks less.Also to add more to the allergy to the adhesives and the plastic bandaids, it seems to be very common even amongst other brands, so im not saying tis only caused by this brand. but since the plastic ones seemed to cause a greater contact dermatitis than the fabric ones, i think its partially due to the pulling of the adhesives. On one occaison it may have resulted in a painful pimple induced by contact dermatitis.if you have atopic dermatitis or already inflammed or damaged skin that isnt caused by injury, the chances of the bandaids causing contact dermatitis is much higher since your prone to a skin reaction anyways. the longer the bandaids stay on the more likely it will cause a rash, so make sure to immediately remove the bandaid and switch it out often since it accumulates dirt and debris after a day or two.note only use it if your atopic dermatitis is currently WEEPing and you have already put on cream or ointment on it(Rx), and you must consult a physician before doing this

Se despegan con la humedad, aunque sean un par de gotas de agua o el mismo sudor...y si, son muchas banditas, pero igual ocupas muchas mas porque tienes que reemplazarlas a cada ratito...
comparer au prix en pharmacie c'est très avantageux ... plusieurs modèles .... bonne qualités.....
